alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:59PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Marshall and southwestern DeKalb Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 657 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Crossville, or 8 miles northeast of Boaz. This storm was drifting to the east around 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Geraldine, Lakeview, Hopewell, Arona, Kilpatrick, Painter, Rodentown, Peeks Corner and Whiton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
